snippet: After a pair of badminton players were disqualified and a 16-year-old’s record swim victory was questioned, Chinese media pointed the blame in several directions.
abstract: News that Chinese badminton players Yu Yang and Wang Xiaoli were disqualified from the Olympics adds to the outrage in China over suggestions that 16-year-old Ye Shiwen's record swim victory may have been aided by performance-enhancing drugs.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research. Dan Levin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After a pair of badminton players were disqualified and a 16-year-old’s record swim victory was questioned, Chinese media pointed the blame in several directions.

headline.seo: Shame and Indignation in China After Badminton and Swimming Controversies
headline.main: Shame and Indignation in China as Its Olympians Come Under Fire
headline.print_headline: Shame and Indignation in China as Its Olympians Come Under Fire
